alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 19 at 1:50AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northern Portage... Geauga...northeastern Cuyahoga...Lake and northeastern Summit Counties Until 315 AM EDT.... At 146 AM EDT, radar indicated an intense area of lake effect snow moving into eastern Cuyahoga and Lake Counties. This area of heavier snow and graupel was moving southeast at 25 mph. Accumulations on are roadways are possible, especially near and south of I-90. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Up to 2 inches of quick snow accumulation... Locations impacted include... Painesville, Willowick, Chardon, Fairport Harbor, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Solon, Willoughby, Hudson, Twinsburg, Eastlake, Streetsboro, Warrensville Heights, Macedonia, South Russell, Madison, Middlefield and Garrettsville. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 312, 313, 314, 315, 317, 318, 319, 320, 323, 324, 325, 326, 329, 330, and 331.
